name: ineffaceable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is ineffaceable, it is not possible to remove it: She left an ineffaceable mark on the music industry. This song made a powerful and ineffaceable impression upon me when I first heard it as a teenager.
More examplesFewer examplesThe war has left an ineffaceable stain on the culture of the region.It was obvious that the poor dog still had an ineffaceable memory of its former owner.Bones that have been uncovered at the site bear the ineffaceable traces of disease and malnutrition.
